Class Decide

java.lang.Object
Decide
public class Decide
extends java.lang.Object
A class that decides whether to launch an interreceptor missile based on radar information. There are several Launch Interceptor Conditions that might need to be met for the launch to happen.

  • Method Details

    • DECIDE

      public boolean DECIDE​(double[][] POINTS, Decide.PARAMETERS parameters, Decide.CMATRIX LCM, boolean[] PUV)
      The method of the class that decides whether to launch an interreceptor missile based on radar information. There are several Launch Interceptor Conditions that might need to be met for the launch to happen. The LIC:s are set by looking at whether any of the data points conform to different conditions, such as being in a circle of radius 1 or having a certain angle between them. Depending on which LIC:s are met and which of them should be considered for your specific launch, the function then decides whether to LAUNCH (true) or not (false). Some input variables are global so they aren't included.
      Parameters:
      POINTS - Array containing the coordinates of data points.
      parameters - Struct holding parameters for the LICâ€™s.
      LCM - for the Logical Connector Matrix.
      PUV - for the Preliminary Unlocking Vector.
      Returns:
      If it should LAUNCH (true) or not (false).

    • ANGLE

      public double ANGLE​(double[] a, double[] b, double[] c)
      Calculates the angle between three points using the law of cosines. Point b is considered the vertex and an edge is added between point a and b, and point b and c
      Parameters:
      a - , a point
      b - , a point
      c - , a point
      Returns:
      angle between three points when an edge is added between point a and b, and point b and c
